intro: Licaria areolata, commonly known as the spotted licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a distinctive spotted or mottled appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Licaria areolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
